summary: Worker.runReplayHistory() doesn't automatically handle serialized History objects from fetchHistory(). Users must manually convert with History.fromObject(), creating confusion since the method already handles Web UI/CLI JSON formats differently.
userImpact: Users attempting to serialize and replay workflow histories from fetchHistory() encounter confusing proto serialization errors and must manually convert using History.fromObject().
rootCause: runReplayHistory() detects and auto-converts Web UI/CLI JSON format but doesn't recognize History objects serialized via JSON.stringify(), requiring manual History.fromObject() conversion.
proposedFix: Enhance runReplayHistory() to automatically detect and convert History objects serialized as JSON using History.fromObject(), similar to existing Web UI/CLI format handling.
workaround: Use History.fromObject(JSON.parse(serializedHistory)) to manually convert serialized History objects before passing to runReplayHistory().
keyQuote: What would be nice is if it could also detect where it's being passed a History object serialized into a JSON object
